definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: His final breakthrough came when he obtained a copy of a manuscript.
sentences.chinese: 贾维斯最终在一份手稿上的复印件上找到了突破口。

sentences.english: Ben jonson tells us that shakespeare never had to revise a manuscript.
sentences.chinese: 本琼森告诉我们莎士比亚从来无须订正手稿。

sentences.english: The Canterbury Tales exist(s) in many manuscripts.
sentences.chinese: 《坎特伯雷的故事》有许多手稿。

sentences.english: This is the original scroll version.
sentences.chinese: 而这本是最初版，完全照手稿印出来的。

sentences.english: Their first form was very often a manuscript.
sentences.chinese: 它们最初都只是抄写的手稿。
巴黎，国家图书馆，中文手稿9277。

sentences.english: The manuscript requires an expert to understand it.
sentences.chinese: 这份手稿只有专家才看得懂。

sentences.english: The lost manuscript was found in a repository in France.
sentences.chinese: 丢失的手稿在法国的一个存放处被找到了。

sentences.english: Would you please blue-pencil this manuscript?
sentences.chinese: 你能校阅一下这份手稿吗？

sentences.english: Above all, do not be afraid to experiment with what you have written.
sentences.chinese: 总之，不要怕对你的手稿做了什么实验。

sentences.english: This is the evidence she blundered upon in a manuscript.
sentences.chinese: 这是我在一份手稿中偶然发现的证据。

sentences.english: Now then, this is the only problem that does not figure in the pages of The Garden.
sentences.chinese: 可是《花园》手稿中惟独没有出现这个问题。

sentences.english: Yesterday, I read a novel in manuscript.
sentences.chinese: 昨天，我读了一篇小说手稿。

sentences.english: The facticity of manuscript is indubitability.
sentences.chinese: 手稿的真实性是毋庸置疑。

sentences.english: In a fury, he consigned all his manuscripts to the flames.
sentences.chinese: 盛怒之下，他将所有的手稿都付之一炬。

sentences.english: All the objectionable words and phrases were edited out of the manuscripts.
sentences.chinese: 所有可能引起异议的词句都从手稿中删掉了。

definition: rough sketch (of a painting)/(of an official) to approve a document by signing it
manuscript copy of a book (before the printing press)
authentic (painting or calligraphy)/genuine work (of famous artist)
